title: Apostle Paul Quiz - Easy Level
description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Apostle Paul in the Bible.

questions.question: Before his conversion, what was Saul's attitude toward Christians?
questions.explanation: Acts 8:3 shows that Saul was actively persecuting the church by going from house to house to arrest Christians.

questions.question: Where was Saul traveling when he experienced his dramatic conversion?
questions.explanation: Acts 9:3-6 describes Saul's encounter with Jesus on the road to Damascus, leading to his conversion.

questions.question: In which city did Paul and Barnabas begin their first missionary journey?
questions.explanation: Acts 13:1-3 shows that Paul and Barnabas were sent out from the church in Antioch for their first missionary journey.

questions.question: What was the main issue discussed at the Jerusalem Council where Paul was present?
options: Whether to build a new temple
Whether to collect offerings for the poor
Whether to stop preaching to Gentiles
questions.explanation: Acts 15:5-11 records the debate about circumcision for Gentile believers, a key topic at the Jerusalem Council.

questions.question: During which missionary journey did Paul spend 18 months teaching in Corinth?
questions.explanation: Acts 18:11 states that Paul stayed in Corinth for a year and a half during his second missionary journey.

questions.question: True or False: Paul was arrested in Jerusalem and later taken to Caesarea for trials.
questions.explanation: Acts 21:27-36 and Acts 23:23-35 show Paul was arrested in Jerusalem and transferred to Caesarea for trial.

questions.question: Who was the Roman governor before whom Paul first gave his defense in Caesarea?
questions.explanation: Acts 24:24-25 shows Paul giving his defense before Governor Felix.

questions.question: What happened to Paul during his voyage to Rome that is recorded in Acts?
options: He was welcomed warmly in Rome
questions.explanation: Acts 27:39-44 and 28:1 describe Paul's shipwreck on the island of Malta during his journey to Rome.

questions.question: What key doctrine did Paul emphasize in Romans regarding how people are made right with God?
questions.explanation: Romans 3:28 highlights that a person is justified by faith apart from works of the law.

questions.question: True or False: Paul described the church as the 'body of Christ' in his letters.
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 12:27 states that believers collectively form the body of Christ.

questions.question: Which letter of Paul contains instructions about spiritual gifts and their proper use in the church?
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians chapters 12-14 discuss spiritual gifts and their use in the church.

questions.question: What did Paul say about the resurrection of the dead in 1 Corinthians 15?
options: Christ's resurrection guarantees believers will also be raised
questions.correctAnswer: Christ's resurrection guarantees believers will also be raised
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 15:20-22 teaches that Christ's resurrection is the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep, promising resurrection for believers.

questions.question: Paul refers to a 'thorn in the flesh' given to him. What was its purpose according to him?
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 12:7 explains Paulâ€™s thorn was given to keep him from becoming conceited.

questions.question: True or False: Paul was imprisoned in Rome and was allowed to receive visitors while under house arrest.
questions.explanation: Acts 28:30-31 states Paul was under house arrest in Rome but welcomed all who came to him.

questions.question: Paul was known as the Apostle to the ______.
questions.explanation: Romans 11:13 refers to Paul as the apostle to the Gentiles, highlighting his mission focus.
